column4: anyone knows how to uninstall ubuntu without formatting drive?
i need to uninstall one of my 2 ubuntu's
i have another ubuntu on a different drive meaning boot is a bit'h now
i'd rather remove the ubuntu i dont need and see if it can detect my other ubuntu
i have like 60 gigs of stuff i dont know whats inside
ok how about enabling write on partitioned drives?
let me get this straight, you have 1 drive, with Windows and Ubuntu, and now you have a second drive, and you want to set it up XP on one drive, and Ubunntu on the other?
ko, and how is this different fromw hat i said?
why don't you jsut download gparted live, and delete your ubuntu partitions ont eh 80gig drive, and format them as NTFS(thus turning them back over to XP))
so let me understand this, you want to keep the partitions on your 80gig drive, but you want to remove Ubuntu?
ok, then format the two partitions on the 80gig drive(assuming you have swap and ext3), as ext3, adn Windows will never see them, but they'll be there if you want them
